sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It's Monday, the 6th of December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Very warm welcome to the programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Let's start by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: A raft of new COVID-19 measures come into force across Europe this week, including in Ireland, where mandatory tests are now required to enter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Rescuers are searching for survivors in Indonesia after Mount Semeru erupted on Java Island on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: At least 14 people have died and many more have been injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Violence erupts near Paris as French far-right TV personality Eric Zemmour holds his first campaign rally on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This week sees several countries imposing new anti-Covid measures ranging from lockdowns for the unvaccinated to travel restrictions. On Sunday, Dublin began obliging all passengers arriving in Ireland to show proof of a negative coronavirus test result.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Once in the country, a further test is required. It's all part of a raft of new restrictions including shutting nightclubs due to the emergence of the new Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Switzerland has done a U-turn on an initial call for people arriving to enter quarantine, replacing it with further testing. And from today, Covid certificates will be required and face masks will have to be worn in a wider list of situations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile from Tuesday morning the UK will also insist that anyone heading its way must have a negative pre-departure COVID test in order to enter the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They will also need to take a PCR test before the end of their second day in the UK and have to self-isolate at least until their negative result comes back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: While in France, the government is set to hold a special meeting today to see if it's necessary to take additional measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But not everyone agrees with the restrictions. On Sunday, Denmark became the latest country to see protests. Hundreds marched through the streets of the capital Copenhagen to show their anger at the health restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The government has reintroduced mandatory face coverings in some places and on public transport and is offering vaccines to children between 5 and 11 years old.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Earlier in the Belgian capital police had used tear gas and water cannon on protesters when thousands turned out trying to march up to the headquarters of the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A line of riot police prevented them from getting there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Today, the so-called Super Green Pass comes into effect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: But what is it about?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Well, it's a reinforced version of the already existing Green Pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Italy's health certificate showing the holder has been vaccinated against COVID-19, has tested negative for COVID or has recovered from the disease. But differently from the original certificate, which allows access to social, sporting, cultural venues, this one in particular only applies to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: those people who've been fully vaccinated against COVID or have recovered from the disease. Passes based on testing will be still available to access all workplaces and public transport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Clearly, the move aims to target those people who have decided not to get vaccinated. And despite the fact that the overall number of COVID-19 cases here in Italy has increased, the government says the situation is under control. But as EU member states debate whether or not to make COVID-19 vaccinations mandatory, we asked Italians what's their take on the measure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The super green pass is much better than making COVID vaccinations compulsory because it gives people the option to choose and maintain a certain form of freedom as they get on with their lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I think making vaccinations mandatory could be a huge task for the state when it comes to putting the measures into effect and ensuring that people comply with that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It doesn't come as easy as we think.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I believe the Green Pass has worked so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Super Green Pass looks like a temporary solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I think it's time for the Italian government to introduce tighter measures. It's time to make bolder decisions. Something more drastic is needed that could work in the long term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I think in the beginning everyone thought the common sense among people would prevail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But as we can see, it hasn't been the case so making vaccinations mandatory is the only solution for now it looks like italy satisfied with the so-called green pasta scheme we'll see whether or not the country will follow the example of austria which has become the first country to introduce compulsory vaccination in europe george orgio Orlandi, Euronews, in Rome. Rescuers are searching for survivors amid the smoldering debris and thick mud after the sudden eruption of Indonesia's Mount Semeru on Java Island on Saturday. The volcano spewed

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: thick columns of ash more than 12,000 meters into the sky, then buried villages and farmland in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: At least 14 people are known to have died and many more have been injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Search and rescue efforts have been hampered by heavy rains creating tonnes of mud, swamping homes and destroying roads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The country's National Disaster Mitigation Agency spokesperson said that 56 people have been hospitalised, mostly with burns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Emergency shelters have been set up for more than 1,300 people after they fled their homes, but the government is organizing a massive evacuation of the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Mount Semeru has erupted many times over the last 200 years and is one of 129 volcanoes, which the authorities keep under watch in Indonesia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: of 129 volcanoes which the authorities keep under watch in Indonesia. More than 62,000 people call Semeru's fertile slopes home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: It last erupted in January with no casualties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: As part of his five-day tour of Cyprus and Greece, Pope Francis returned to Lesbos on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: His last visit to the island was in 2016, during the early years of the migration crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Part of his eastern Mediterranean tour is aimed at drawing attention to the suffering of migrants and refugees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: He even declared that Europe is torn by nationalist egoism on the matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Many refugees welcomed his visit. I have this kind of feeling to welcome pop on this island.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: It's going to be very good hope for the refugees inside the camp, even they are Muslim, even they are Christian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: For all of us, it is very, very good things and we believe that when the pop will leave and the situation of the refugees' life inside the camp will change, and it's going to be better, much more than now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: This refugee says the Pope's visit is very important, especially for those who have spent already two years on the island of Lesbos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: During his meeting with the Archbishop of Athens, Francis brought up the problem of migration and solidarity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The 84-year-old's visit to the Greek capital on Saturday was the first by a Pope since John Paul II, the Archbishop of Athens, Francis brought up the problem of migration and solidarity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The 84-year-old's visit to the Greek capital on Saturday was the first by a Pope since John Paul II in 2001.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: His trip is also focused on improving recently mended ties between the Vatican and Greek Orthodox churches. You follow. and an intense back and forth between the lead contenders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Verstappen was penalized for going off course during the second restart and was ordered to yield to Hamilton.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Due to communication confusions, the British driver rear-ended the Dutch racer as a result.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: This victory marks Hamilton's third consecutive win, tallying up his totals to eight wins for the season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: He is also now tied with Verstappen for points, though the Dutchman still leads the championship on most wins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: World number two Daniil Medvedev has led the Russian Federation to a third Davis Cup title beating out Marin Cilic and Croatia with a score of 7-6 6-2. This

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: comes on the back of the first Russian singles match won by Andrei Rublev against Borna Goyo. Putting the Russians ahead in Madrid Rublev opened the finals with a score of 6-4 7-6. This victory marked the first Davis Cup title since 2006 for the Russian Federation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Lots more to come on the program. Do stay with us, we're taking a short break.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: On Monday, Austria will have a new chancellor, Karl Niehammer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Niehammer has been interior minister since January 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The 49-year-old long-time professional soldier and lieutenant is considered a hardliner, consistently defending Sebastian Kurz's tough stance on refugee policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On Twitter, he endorsed Denmark's restrictive stance on migration, tweeting after a meeting with the Danish migration minister, Denmark is an ally of Austria when it comes to fighting illegal migration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Niehammer studied political communication and is considered well connected in the Austrian People's Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After the terrorist attack in Vienna on the 2nd of November 2020, Nehammer was blamed for failures of the Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution and Counterterrorism, which reported to him as head of the Interior Ministry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Four people were killed and 23 injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Nehammer admitted mistakes by his authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Everyone has certainly worked to the best of their ability, he said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the fact is that the terrorists managed to fool the people in it and get an early release through this." Nehammer takes over Austria in the midst of the coronavirus crisis, but says he's looking forward to the new task.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He was already responsible for various lockdowns as interior minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: It is Austria's sixth chancellor in six years who is sworn in today in Vienna. Karl Nehammer, the previous minister of the interior, replaces Alexander Schallenberg, who was in office for barely two months. This renewed change of chancellor was triggered by the now final political withdrawal of Sebastian

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Kurz.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: New chancellor Karl Nehammer is considered a hardliner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The 49-year-old Viennese is a trained professional soldier and constantly engages in anti-migration rhetoric.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Ensuring security in the country is also a major concern for the conservative politician of the Austrian People's Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: No policy reversal is to be expected with him on Austria's anti-Covid measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: With a full lockdown and the announced vaccine mandate, the Alpine Republic is currently pursuing one of the toughest approaches in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: While the recently registered record infection numbers have now been cut in half, resentment among the population is growing at the same time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Once again, more than 40,000 opponents of the measures took to the streets in Vienna this weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Five police officers were injured during clashes with demonstrators.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: And whether the frequent change of chancellor is the best tactic against the ever-growing division in Austrian society remains to be seen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Johannes Blechberger, Euronews, Vienna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: En el día de ayer, la Constitución. Rival demonstrations have been held in France, with opponents and supporters of TV pundit turned presidential candidate Eric Zemmour taken to the streets as he held his first

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: campaign meeting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Zemmour has rocked the French political establishment with his overtly nationalistic and anti-immigration rhetoric.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And he doubled down on that stance in front of his supporters on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the capital Paris, more than 2,000 people gathered to hear leftist candidate Jean-Luc Mélenchon denounce the far right and its domination of the French political agenda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We are here to proclaim once again, he said, that no, emancipation, schools and research.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, the head of the Paris region, Valérie Pécresse, won the contest to become the presidential candidate for the mainstream right Republican Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: candidate for the mainstream right, Republican Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: French far-right candidate Eric Zemmour got a rock star welcome at his first official rally in the outskirts of Paris on Sunday, where he promised supporters the beginning of a new France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A new France. The stakes are huge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: If I win this election, it will be the start of winning back the most beautiful country

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The controversial TV pundit has been called racist, sexist and anti-Semitic for harsh

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: remarks about migration and French identity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now he says he wants to be known as the only candidate capable of saving France from the decline and decadence he says the nation is facing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Over the past few months, you may have heard many things about me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some have said that I am brutal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Yes, this may have happened because I am a passionate person and my commitment is absolute and France is on the brink of collapse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For his supporters, the flamboyant candidate is just what the country needs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Even if it is time excessive, I think we need that, at least at the start, to bring order to our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I believe it's important to return to traditional and censored values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: It's important. And they must be revalued. We need more drastic decisions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: I adore him. I adore him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: France is going nowhere and he's the only one with ideas to retake France and the whole West because the whole Western world is losing its identity, its culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But the hope and appearance of a festive atmosphere quickly turned when anti-racism campaigners attempted to protest at the event. Zemmour's supporters threw punches in chairs and the activists had to be escorted out by police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Zemmour accused the government and the media of fueling animosity and dividing the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: If they hate me, it's because they hate you. If they despise me, it's because they despise you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Nothing is off-limits against me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: My opponents want me dead politically, the journalists want me dead socially, and the jihadists want me dead altogether.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's unclear whether Éric Zemmour can further widen his support base and actually reach the second round of France's presidential election next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, his mere presence in this race is already proof that France has lurched to the right and his campaign has just started to set the tone of what the political debate is going to be like here in this country ahead of 2022.
